channel.title: New York - Things To Do
channel.description:
Hello all,
I'm travelling from the UK to US visiting NYC in 2 weeks time with my girlfriend, we're staying for 5 nights in Manhattan somewhere, just wondering for those that have been and/or live in the city, what would you recommend doing or going to see?

item.title: New York - Things To Do
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

Miss Silabsoft:

Everytime I’m in new york I spend half the day eating various foods and walking around.

aka http://53rdand6th.com/

Read full topic

item.title: New York - Things To Do
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“casey., post:7, topic:549105”]the attraction pass just covers a lot of neighborhood tours and museums.

other ideas:

When your at FiDi/Brooklyn Bridge/WTC ride the Staten Island Ferry. Really cool views of the city/Statue of Liberty. But don’t go to Staten Island. Just ride back.[/quote]
Thanks casey, will do. Think we’re gonna go on the ‘big bus’ (hop on hop off) 2 day tour on the first two days to get our bearings a bit.

[quote=“asshole_rule, post:10, topic:549105”]I went up there last month. What hotel are you staying at if you don’t mind me asking, lol?

I did normal tourist things like the statue of liberty, empire state building, twin tower memorial, etc.[/quote]
The New York Palace

the elve age:

Silent, we should meet up. I live in Tennessee, but its only like a 14hr drive. Worth it, guaratee

I’m sure it would, don’t think the misses would be pleased though

I was actually in Chicago and Wisconsin on business last month too, that would’ve been a bit closer!

Read full topic

item.title: New York - Things To Do
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:6, topic:549105”]Thank you very much all of you, particularly casey, I’ll be adding a few of those onto our list of things to do.

One last one, is one of those New York attraction pass things worth it? I’m aware that a few different companies seem to offering it.

http://www.metmuseum.org/visit/hours-and-admission - Note that the prices are “recommended”

No real interest in art whatsoever… still worth going?

Well there’s some things you should know: first off, if you see gum on the street, leave it there. It’s not free candy. Second, there are like thirty Ray’s Pizzas and they all say they’re the original, but the real one’s on eleventh. And if you see a sign for a Peep show, it doesn’t mean they’re letting you look at presents before Christmas.

Why on earth would I pick gum off the street? I’ll bear the pizza thing in mind though haha, cheers.[/quote]

It was a movie reference

Read full topic

One last one, is one of those New York attraction pass things worth it? I’m aware that a few different companies seem to offering it.

vManlyMan:

http://www.metmuseum.org/visit/hours-and-admission - Note that the prices are “recommended”

No real interest in art whatsoever… still worth going?

reyx7:

Well there’s some things you should know: first off, if you see gum on the street, leave it there. It’s not free candy. Second, there are like thirty Ray’s Pizzas and they all say they’re the original, but the real one’s on eleventh. And if you see a sign for a Peep show, it doesn’t mean they’re letting you look at presents before Christmas.

Why on earth would I pick gum off the street? I’ll bear the pizza thing in mind though haha, cheers.

item.title: New York - Things To Do
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

Take a day to do a general city tour (Time square, Financial District, Central Park, Brooklyn Bridge, etc). They have hop on-hop off tour buses or you can take the Subway around.

Go to the top of the a skyscraper to take in the view(Rockerfeller Center has good views of the Empire State building, FiDi, WTC) or go to the WTC to get a view of Midtown, East Side, etc). Each place is around $30 to go up.

Check out the museums, mainly the museum of modern art. Its probably 3 blocks from central park so you could probably combine these two and make a day out of it.

Don’t eat at known chain restaurants. Lots of great food in Little Italy and elsewhere.

The main this is GET THE FUCK OUT OF MANHATTAN and see the whole city.

Check out the Yankees Stadium(Subway), Coney Island(Subway). Lots of unique culture, art, and food outside of the city.
A few Ski/Snowboard resorts within driving distance

Source: My company has a branch up in FiDi, so I’m up there fairly often, grew up there.

Read full topic

item.title: New York - Things To Do
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

If you’ve never seen an NBA game in person, you could go to Madison Square Garden and see the Knicks play. Also seeing a broadway show in New York would be something interesting. (I don’t live in NY, but if I was visiting it I would do these things.)

Read full topic
